title: (x) Santa Barbara Bank & Trust - hand lettered {Yves}
content:
Need to identify a font used in the logo of Santa Barbara Bank & Trust. [http://www.sbbt.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012214259/http:/www.sbbt.com/ "http://www.sbbt.com")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [sbbt.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012214259/http:/typophile.com/files/sbbt.gif) | 4.6 KB |

 [‹ (x) Angular tech "Escape" - Gamer {Dav}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012214259/http:/typophile.com/node/16272 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Nokia typefaces by Erik Spiekermann - proprietary {Mark S} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012214259/http:/typophile.com/node/16264 "Go to next forum topic")
author: albionhome

comments.content: I have no idea whether this is even a font, but there’s a [better image of the logo here](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012214259/http:/www.losolivosca.com/images/sbbank.gif) and [a massive one here](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012214259/http:/www.decoloresartgroup.com/images/LOGO-SBBT.jpg).
I don’t want to disappoint you, but this looks like it was skillfully lettered by hand. I don’t think you will find a digitised typeface that looks like that.

What Yves said. That’s an old, nicely-handlettered logo. There are some nice friendly new blackletters out there, but they are not condensed, simplified Lombardics.

Hey, typophiles, there’s a gap in the market: Condensed simplified Lombardic caps. Get drawing and make a new font! Maybe Albion Home will commission it?
Maybe... Thanks so much for the input!

If you want a style but not an exact match try Faust

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/faust-text/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012214259/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/faust-text/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/faust-text/")

also, some of Dan Solo’s nouveau types have a similar feel.

Another similar one, but with a little more... flair is [Kynges](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012214259/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/kynges-x-nf/).

- Lex
